objectives: Students will discuss daily routines and habits using Slang/Street register language
Students will engage with Action/Adventure themed scenarios related to daily routines and habits
Students will demonstrate appropriate use of slang level vocabulary and expressions
Students will create dialogues combining daily routines and habits content with Action/Adventure narrative elements

warm_up.description: Students explore daily routines and habits through a Action/Adventure lens using Slang/Street language
warm_up.scenario: Imagine a high-stakes action sequence involving daily routines and habits

main_activities.description: Students learn and practice slang register vocabulary related to daily routines and habits in a action context
Students engage in action themed role-play about daily routines and habits using slang register
Students create original action themed content about daily routines and habits in slang register

discussion_questions: How would you describe daily routines and habits in a Action/Adventure scenario?
What chase or pursuit might be involved in daily routines and habits?
Can you create a Action/Adventure story about daily routines and habits?
How does daily routines and habits change when viewed through a Action/Adventure perspective?
What slang register expressions would you use to discuss this action scenario?

role_play_scenarios.scenario: Action/Adventure situation involving daily routines and habits
roles: Character A: Using slang register in action context
Character B: Responding in slang register within action theme

topic_genre_blend: daily routines and habits with chase
daily routines and habits with pursuit
daily routines and habits with danger

teacher_transformation_guide.register_guidance: Use Slang/Street throughout: Casual street language, colloquialisms, youth speak
teacher_transformation_guide.genre_guidance: Frame all content with Action/Adventure theme: High energy, excitement, physical challenges

assessment.register_focus: Students demonstrate mastery of Slang/Street register
assessment.genre_focus: Students engage with Action/Adventure themed content
criteria: Appropriate use of slang register language
Comprehension of topic within new context

methodology: Augmented CLT with Register & Genre Transformation
